title: The era that saw the beginnings of spolia in building also witnessed the birth of the cento – a poem produced out of lines taken from other poems. In perhaps the most celebrated example, Ausonius’s Cento nuptialis, phrases from Virgil are re-assembled to describe a couple’s wedding night.34 The cento is an extreme case, but the practice of literary quotation in antiquity was governed by a different sense of originality
For an English-language analog, see Ausonius and Slavitt
There are several possible contenders, but the modern quotation mark might have debuted in Pierre de la Ramée’s Dialectic of 1555; cf
